items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the current bid limit of $83,400 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts and purchase orders for the period of September 10, 2013 through October 9, 2013 as noted in the attached documents.

On September 10, 2013 The Board of Trustees approved Workforce Institute’s $146,691.00 Butte-Glenn Community College District Agreement for Professional Services.
	 
This contract awards Workforce Institute an additional $32,919.75 to provide additional “Covered California Certified Enrollment Counselor Training” to multiple participants, including hospitals, healthcare providers, licensed insurance agents, and community entities.  
	 
The total contract amount is $179,610.75.

items.item_details:
Board of Trustees to approve out of state travel for student, Alex Ward, Charles Stevens, Ashley King, Jonathan Calameteos, and Advisor Elizabeth Eckford for the conference in New Orleans, LA.  The students will leave San Jose on Wednesday, November 20, 2013 and will be returning on Sunday, November 24, 2013. The amount granted to students for travel was provided by the Associated Students in the amount of $7,100.00.  
		 
The purpose of this conference is for members of the executive council, and San Jose City College students in higher leadership roles, to bring back special training in order to ensure the success of the newly formed and re-chartered ASG Student Senate. Conference attendees will bring back the proper training necessary to share with the next ASG Student Senate Council to make sure that they have the tools needed to function appropriately.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve out of state travel for students Alex Ward, Charles Stevens, Ashley King, and Jonathan Calameteos.

items.item_text: Adoption of the Measure G Bond Programs Consent Agenda
items.item_text_raw: 1. Adoption of the Measure G Bond Programs Consent Agenda

items.item_details:
The previous Measure G 2004 Bond List Revision was approved by the Board of Trustees on August 13, 2013. Revisions are presented to the Board on a quarterly basis and as needed. 
	 
This proposed Bond List Revision reflects the efforts to plan and prioritize Measure G-2004 Bond projects at Evergreen Valley College.  The changes included in this Bond List Revision align project scope and budget with planned implementation efforts for the 2025 EVC Facilities Master Plan to gain efficiency and economy of scale. Also included in this proposed revision are changes to reallocate project savings from completed District projects.  There are no revisions to San Jose City College projects in this request.  
	 
The Measure G-2004 Bond List Revision dated November 12, 2013 includes the following actions:
	 
Project 205: Campus Safety Upgrades
Budget in the amount of $176,573 is being transferred from Project 205 - Campus Safety Upgrades to new Project 224 – East Plaza Reconfiguration to establish budget for design and construction to reconfigure the Performing Arts plaza and bus circle consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan.  Project 205 is complete.
                                                      
Project 210: Modernization of Existing Facilities
Partial scope and budget in the amount of $111,148 is being transferred from Project 210 - Modernization of Existing Facilities to new Project 224 – East Plaza Reconfiguration to reconfigure the Performing Arts plaza and bus circle consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan.
	 
Project 218: Furniture & Equipment
Budget in the amount of $4,300,000 is being transferred from Project 218 - Furniture & Equipment to new Project 223 – Central Green to establish budget for design and construction to improve and develop the campus core consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan.
Budget in the amount of $1,383,877 is being transferred from Project 218 - Furniture & Equipment to Project 224 – East Plaza Reconfiguration to establish budget for design and construction to reconfigure the Performing Arts plaza and bus circle consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan.
Project 218 is complete.
	 
Project 220: Plant & Utilities Infrastructure
Budget in the amount of $490,393 is being transferred from Project 220 - Plant & Utilities Infrastructure to new Project 224 – East Plaza Reconfiguration to establish budget for design and construction to reconfigure the Performing Arts plaza and bus circle consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan.  Project 220 is complete.
	 
Project 223: Central Green
Budget in the amount of $4,300,000 is being transferred from Project 218 - Furniture & Equipment to new Project 223 – Central Green to establish budget for design and construction to improve and develop the campus core consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan.
	 
Project 224: East Plaza Reconfiguration
Budget in the amount of $176,573 is being transferred from Project 205 - Campus Safety Upgrades to new Project 224 – East Plaza Reconfiguration.
Partial scope and budget in the amount of $111,148 is being transferred from Project 210 - Modernization of Existing Facilities to new Project 224 – East Plaza Reconfiguration.
Budget in the amount of $1,383,877 is being transferred from Project 218 - Furniture & Equipment to new Project 224 – East Plaza Reconfiguration.
Budget in the amount of $490,393 is being transferred from Project 220 - Plant & Utilities Infrastructure to new Project 224 – East Plaza Reconfiguration.
All transfers made to new Project 224 are to establish budget for design and construction to reconfigure the Performing Arts plaza and bus circle consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan.
	 
Project 303: DW Project Admin & Other Operating Expenses
Project savings transferred from Project 308- DW Technology Upgrades in the amount of $184,453 and Project 310- General Safety Upgrades in the amount of $5,474 to cover additional program management costs.
	 
Project 308: DW Project Admin & Other Operating Expenses
Project savings transferred to Project 303- DW Project Admin & Other Operating Expenses in the amount of $184,453 to cover additional program management costs.
	 
Project 310: General Safety Upgrades
Project savings transferred to Project 303- DW Project Admin & Other Operating Expenses in the amount of $5,474 to cover additional program management costs.
	 
These Bond List Revisions have been approved by the Evergreen Valley College Vice President of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions to the Measure G - 2004 bond list, as presented.
items.item_text: Measure G-2004 Bond Program: Bond List Revision
items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G-2004 Bond Program: Bond List Revision

items.item_details:
As presented at the October 22, 2013 Board meeting, the District and Colleges are pursuing a number of Measure G-2004 funded projects that are in need of project management assistance:
	 
Joint Use 21st Century Education Center in Milpitas – The District needs project leadership to facilitate the programming, design, and construction of the future building.
	 
Physical Education Building (SJCC) - The College has not been able to commit the level of resources required to manage this project.  The PE complex project has a direct impact on the Measure G-2010 bond and without support the delay of this project has a negative impact to the G-2010 program and risks escalation costs associated with the delay.
	 
Modernization of Existing Facilities (EVC) - EVC expects to hire design firms, consultants and construction services for various projects including security infrastructure, new structures for grounds equipment and warehouse, and new bleachers at the soccer athletic field. 
	 
East Plaza Reconfiguration (EVC) – As part of the overall campus site improvements, and consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan, the College has identified reconfiguration of the plaza and bus drop-off at the east section of the College as a priority.  EVC expects to hire design firms, consultants and construction services to perform this work.  The Board will be asked to approve this new project as part of a Measure G-2004 Bond List Revision at its November 12, 2013 Board meeting.
	 
Central Green Development (EVC) – The center of campus formerly housed a cluster of portable buildings as temporary classrooms.  These were removed in 2012.  As part of the overall campus site improvements, and consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan, the College has identified development of the central core of the College as a priority.  EVC expects to hire design firms, consultants and construction services to perform this work.  The Board will be asked to approve this new project as part of a Measure G-2004 Bond List Revision at its November 12, 2013 Board meeting.
	 
Division of State Architect (DSA) – Closeout efforts continue with DSA on past projects that remain uncertified after their completion.  In many cases the applications have been closed as uncertified and must be reopened, additional fees paid, prior design firms contacted, old files researched and new applications with supporting documentation submitted.  Some of these uncertified projects are interfering with approval of applications for new projects and have the potential to create delays until the uncertified projects are satisfactorily closed out.
	 
The budget for Measure G-2004 construction management services is accounted for in each of the remaining project budgets in the Measure G-2004 bond program.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Amendment #04 to Gilbane’s PM/CM agreement to provide CM services for fiscal year 2013/2014 on the remaining Measure G-2004 bond projects for a not-to-exceed amount of $736,415.
items.item_text: Measure G-2004 Bond Program: Project Management Support
items.item_text_raw: 3. Measure G-2004 Bond Program: Project Management Support

items.item_details:
In August 2013 the District received bids for the EVC District Warehouse Carport Project.  The Base Bid scope included two carport structures and renovation of the existing compressed air system.  The bid was structured to allow the District to award based on deductive alternates for Carport B and the compressed air system.  The available budget at the time of contract award was insufficient to support the entire scope of the bid request and by exercising the deductive alternates in the bid, the awarded scope was reduced to fit the budget.  On September 10, 2013 the Board approved a contract with Integra Construction, Inc. to perform this work.  The alternates were written into the contract to allow their acceptance should more funding be arranged.  
	 
The Bond List Revision to Measure G-2004 being presented to the Board at its November 12, 2013 meeting includes allocation of additional funding to the EVC District Warehouse Carport Project for construction of these two alternates: construct the second carport structure and replace the existing air compressor system.  The cost of the accepted alternates is as was provided in the original bid and the contract as Alternates 1 and 2.   
	 
Carport B Structure                                                                                        $61,500
Provide all work associated with construction of Carport B include the following components; foundation, building structure, electrical power and lighting systems.
	 
Existing Air Compressor Replacement                                                           $12,053
Demolish existing air compressor at the garage and provide a new air compressor system with air lines and outlets extension to the new Carport A.
	 
	 
Original Contract Amount                                          $144,947
Accepted Alternates                                                    $73,553
Approved Changes                                                      $0             
	 
Total Contract with accepted alternates                     $218,500
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 001 for Integra Construction, Inc. in the amount of $73,553 for the EVC District Warehouse Carport Project.
items.item_text: Measure G-2004 Bond Program: EVC District Warehouse Carport Project
items.item_text_raw: 4. Measure G-2004 Bond Program: EVC District Warehouse Carport Project

items.item_details:
Proposition 39, which governs the District’s general obligation bonds, requires the establishment of a citizens’ oversight committee.  Following the passage of Measure G-2004 on November 2, 2004, the Board of Trustees took action on May 10, 2005 to establish a Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee.  Measure G-2010 was passed by the voters on November 2, 2010, after which the Board of Trustees took action on December 14, 2010 to amend and restate the bylaws to allow for the existing committee to support both Measure G-2004 and Measure G-2010.
	 
The Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC) is required by statute to meet at least annually to review the District’s Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 bond projects plan and to ensure that bond funds are being appropriately used as authorized by the voters.  There are no penalties defined in law for failure to convene a citizens’ oversight committee; however, the spirit of the law contemplates that districts will make every reasonable effort to ensure that the committee functions at least once each year to fulfill its statutory duties.  The current CBOC convenes quarterly for meetings.
	 
Pursuant to Proposition 39, the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee is required to have a minimum of seven (7) members comprised of one (1) student active in a community college support group, such as student government, two (2) Community-At-Large members, one (1) Senior Citizens’ Organization member, one (1) Business Community member and one (1) Support Organization member.  It is requested that the following applicant be appointed to the Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee by the Board of Trustees to fill the current vacancy. 
	 
Member            Representing
Leo Cortez         Support Organization
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees appoint the Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee applicant as submitted to fill the current vacancy on the committee.
items.item_text: Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee Appointment
items.item_text_raw: 5. Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee Appointment

items.item_details:
As part of the accountability measures for the Measure G-2010 Bond Program, the management team for the program has put into place a formal process for managing, tracking and presenting to the Board of Trustees all revisions to the Measure G-2010 individual project names, scopes and budgets. This process adheres to the accountability standards outlined by Proposition 39 and provides transparency in the evolution of the project list.
	 
These revisions are the result of careful coordination and realignment with the current Facilities Master Plans and the planned implementation of the projects at each campus.
	 
Measure G-2010 Bond List Revision #6 includes the following actions:
	 
Project 32107: South Campus Development
Partial budget in the amount of $2,300,000 is being transferred from Project 32113 - Campus Site Improvements to Project 32107 - South Campus Development to establish budget for fixtures, furnishings and equipment exclusive to programs intended to occupy this project.
	 
Project 32111:  Automotive Technology
Name change to reflect the formal name of the program that will be housed in this building.  
Partial budget in the amount of $1,000,000 is being transferred from Project 32113 - Campus Site Improvements to Project 32111 - Automotive Technology to establish budget for fixtures, furnishings and equipment exclusive to the program intended to occupy this project.
	 
Project 32113: Campus Site Improvements
Partial budget in the amount of $2,300,000 is being transferred to Project 32107- South Campus Development to fund necessary program needs.
Partial budget in the amount of $1,000,000 is being transferred to Project 32111 - Automotive Technology to fund necessary program needs.
Partial budget in the amount of $2,607,816 is being transferred to Project 32702 - IT & Tech Equipment to increase funding for technology and infrastructure needs.
Partial budget in the amount of $100,000 is being transferred to a new project 32122 - EVC Vehicles to fund specific college needs.
	 
Project 32122: EVC Vehicles
Budget in the amount of $100,000 is being transferred from Project 32113 - Campus Site Improvements to new Project 32122 - EVC Vehicles to establish funding for College-specific vehicle purchase to support college operations.
	 
Project 32310: Energy Efficiency - Photovoltaic
Budget of $209,372 is being transferred to Project 32314 - Physical Security Initiative to fund necessary program and security initiatives.  Project 32310 is complete.
	 
Project 32314: Physical Security Initiative
Budget in the amount of $209,372 is being transferred from Project 32310 - Energy Efficiency - Photovoltaic to Project 32314 - Physical Security Initiative to fund necessary program and security initiatives.
	 
Project 32702 – IT & Tech Equipment
Budget in the amount of $2,607,816 is being transferred from Project 32113 - Campus Site Improvements to Project 32702 - IT & Tech Equipment to increase funding for technology and infrastructure needs.
	 
Project 39704 – ITSS/RIE/EIS Software and Hardware
ITSS/RIE/EIS Software and Hardware Project is being divided into two separate projects: Enterprise Resource Planning Conversion and Infrastructure Upgrade. The current budget of $10,000,000 is being split 50/50 between the two new projects ($5,000,000 each). Project 39704 is being renamed to reflect the scope of the new Enterprise Resource Planning Conversion project and a new Project 39705- Infrastructure Upgrades is being created to establish budget and scope for the upgrade of the cyber infrastructure of the District Office.
	 
Project 39705 – Infrastructure Upgrades
Project 39705- Infrastructure Upgrades is being created to establish budget and scope for the upgrade of the cyber infrastructure of the District Office.
	 
These Bond List Revisions have been approved by the Evergreen Valley College Vice President of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions to the Measure G - 2010 bond list, as presented.

items.item_details:
On June 11, 2013 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with Premier Builders, Inc. to provide construction services to renovate existing classroom space into the Photography Lab on the San Jose City College campus. 
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Premier Builders submitted written pricing proposals for changes detailed in the Agenda attachment that include additional or deleted materials, equipment, labor, time extensions as applicable and the prescribed mark-ups.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
The two (2) items in this change order total and add to the contract of $13,180.
	 
Original Contract Amount      $430,705
Previous Change Order(s)       $12,832
Change Order No. 002           $13,180
	 
Total Contract and Changes   $456,717
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 002 for Premier Builders, Inc. in the amount of $13,180 for the San Jose City College Photography Lab Relocation Project.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: SJCC- Photography Lab Relocation #G2010.0046, Project #31121 Change Order No. 002

items.item_details:
On May 14, 2013 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with Swenson & Associates to provide construction services to renovate and upgrade the Central Plant and Police Station at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
This change order includes seven items totaling $39,284.  Swenson & Associates submitted written pricing proposals for changes detailed in the Agenda attachment that include additional work related to unforeseen underground conditions, modifications and changes to certain mechanical and electrical equipment and components, and a credit for a change in material used by the contractor.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                $ 9,965,000
Previous Approved Changes             $      41,148                               
Change Order #003                           $      39,284
	 
Total Contract and Changes              $10,045,432
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order #003 for Swenson & Associates in the amount of $39,284 for the Evergreen Valley College Central Plant and Police Station Renovation Project.

items.item_details:
On July 10, 2013 the board approved a Contract in the amount of $128,000 for District identified miscellaneous electrical upgrades at Evergreen Valley College campus to Radiant Electric, Inc.  During construction of that work various operational upgrades and replacement of equipment have been required and the use of contract allowances were not required to the level anticipated. 
	 
Upgrades, replacement and revisions included:
-  Feeder Replacement
-  Replace Gullo I Fire Alarm Panel
-  Circuit Overload Investigation
-  Grounding Conductor Installation
-  Fire Alarm Troubleshooting & Supervision in Gullo I
	 
Change Order No. 001 includes costs associated with the above items and deduction of remaining allowance funds from the contract.  This change was negotiated for a deductive cost of ($22,312) for a revised contract value of $105,688.
	 
Original Contract Amount      $  128,000
Previous Change Order(s)    $             0
Change Order No. 001          ($   22,312)
Revised Contract Amount      $  105,688
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order 001 in the deductive amount of ($22,312) to Radiant Electric, Inc. for the Electrical Upgrade Project at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_text_raw: 9. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Change Order 001 Radiant Electric, Inc. - Electrical Upgrade Project at Evergreen Valley College

items.item_details:
On July 9, 2013 the Board approved a Contract to Swenson & Associates in the amount of $3,165,000 for replacement of the Gullo Student Centerâs roof, existing windows, corrugated metal siding, fiber cement panels and to install below-grade waterproofing to ensure a watertight building.  The work also includes accessibility and structural changes to the building required by the Division of State Architect.
	 
This change order includes two changes to the scope of the work:  1) Direction to provide two colors for new corrugated metal panels (the design documents referenced a single generic manufacturer color) and 2) Replacement of 6,000 square feet of drywall not shown in the original Gullo design (much of which had suffered water damage) with cement board to provide compatible surface for weather barrier membrane.
	 
Original Contract Amount              $3,165,000
Previous Change Order(s)                          $0
Change Order No. 001                       $50,672
	 
Revised Contract Amount             $3,215,672

items.item_details:
On July 9, 2013 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with JKL Construction Services, Inc. to provide construction services to upgrade and extend underground utilities including power, telecommunications, gas, heating and cooling water to buildings on campus.
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  During excavation several unforeseen conditions and unmarked utilities were encountered which required revisions to the design drawings. In addition, the contractor uncovered existing utilities that were leaking and required repair. JKL has submitted change proposals, which were reviewed for accuracy and conformance with the Contract Documents.
	 
Original Contract Amount             $2,880,567
Previous Approved Changes            $16,453
Change Order No. 002                        $7,193
	 
Total Contract and Changes        $2,904,213
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 002 for JKL Construction Services Inc. in the amount of $7,193 for the San Jose City College Utility Extension Project.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: SJCC- Utility Extension Project #G2010.0052, Project #31110 Change Order No. 002
items.item_text_raw: 11. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: SJCC- Utility Extension Project #G2010.0052, Project #31110 Change Order No. 002

items.item_details:
Allana Buick and Bers (ABB) is the design firm engaged by the District to address the water infiltration and leakage issues at the Gullo Student Center on the EVC campus.  Since the original PAA was approved in May 2012 to address the roof, the District has taken a measured approach to authorizing additional work.  Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) revisions have been issued to expand the ABB assessment to include the exterior wall conditions, to add DSA-mandated design tasks and for focused initial construction administration tasks.  With DSA approval of the project, contractor award and a confirmed contractor schedule, the District should adjust the ABB construction administration duration to conform to that schedule. 
 
In addition, certain changes are requested due to the complexity of the project: provide a conformed set of construction drawings; provide design services for water damaged structural members; add an allowance for an additional month of construction administration; and an allowance for design services related to future unforeseen conditions.
	 
Original Contract Amount      $     95,490
Previous Revision(s)               $   178,460                              
Revision No. 003                    $     79,400
	 
Revised Contract Amount      $   353,350
items.item_recommendation: The Board is asked to approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) Revision No. 003 in the amount of $79,400 to Allana Buick and Bers for additional design and construction administration services for the Evergreen Valley College Gullo Student Center Envelope Upgrade Project.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Gullo Student Center Envelope Upgrade Project
items.item_text_raw: 12. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Gullo Student Center Envelope Upgrade Project

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees adopted the District's operating budget at its meeting on September 10, 2013.  As required by Board Policy 6250, subsequent budget transfers and revisions must be approved by the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the resolution authorizing the budget transfers and revisions of funds within expenditure accounts, and authorizing the appropriation of the receipt of unanticipated revenues in certain programs.

items.item_details: The 2013-14 California State Budget appropriated $25 million to the California Community Colleges Chancellor’s Office to provide two-year planning and implementation grants to create pathways between adult education schools and community colleges that will better serve the educational needs of adult learners.  Assembly Bill 86 outlines expectations for consortium development, planning, and implementation requirements to establish the Adult Education Consortium Program.In alignment with the Board of Trustees’ strategic direction, SJECCD has taken a lead role in actively engaging local K-12 Districts and community organizations over several months and has formed the South Bay Consortium for Adult Education. Consortium members, including SJECCD, are seeking Board level commitment to planning and implementation of adult education for the South Bay region.  It is recommended that Board approve Resolution No. 111213-2 in support of the regional planning and implementation of Adult Education that aligns with SJECCD’s mission, vision and values to educate and empower adult learners.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 111213-2 in support of the South Bay Consortium for Adult Education.

items.item_details: On October 31, 2013, President Obama issued a Presidential Proclamation proclaiming November 2013 as National Native American Heritage Month. In support of this proclamation and in celebration of the achievements of Native American faculty, administrators, staff and students, the San JosĂŠ-Evergreen Community College District participates in events in which Native American culture is celebrated. It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 111213-3 in support of November 2013 as Native American Heritage Month.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 111213-3 to designate November 2013 as Native American Heritage Month.
items.item_text: Resolution No. 111213-3 in Honor of Native American Heritage Month
items.item_text_raw: 3. Resolution No. 111213-3 in Honor of Native American Heritage Month

items.item_details: In September 2013, the California state legislature passed Assembly Concurrent Resolution 25 and declared November 2013 as âSikh American Awareness and Appreciation Month.â  This Resolution would recognize and acknowledge the significant contributions made by  Californians of Sikh heritage to the State and afford all Californians the opportunity to understand, recognize, and appreciate the rich history and shared principles of Sikh Americans. It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 111213-4 in support of November 2013 as Sikh American Awareness and Appreciation Month.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 111213-4 to designate November 2013 as Sikh American Awareness and Appreciation Month.

items.item_details:
Additional articles subject to negotiations for the San Jose Evergreen Community College District's Contract Reopener Proposal with the California School Employees Association, Chapter 363 for 2012-2013
	 
Article 31 Completion of Meet and Negotiation
	 
31.1 During the term of this Agreement, either party to this Agreement may reopen the following issues for the following fiscal years:
	 
2013-14 Article 6, Salary, and Article 7, Benefits in addition to any other articles mutually agreed upon
	 
2014-15 Article 6, Salary, and Article 7, Benefits, and two (2) re-openers each in addition to any other articles mutually agreed upon
	 
2015-16 Article 6, Salary, and Article 7, Benefits, and two (2) re-openers each in addition to any other articles mutually agreed upon
	 
Article 32 Term
	 
32.1 This Agreement shall remain in full force and effect up to and including June 30, 2016 and thereafter shall continue in effect year-by year unless one of the parties notifies the other in writing no later than March 15 of each year of its request to modify, amend, or terminate this Agreement
	 
The District reserves the right to add, amend, delete and/or change any of these proposals.
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
	 
Approve the two additional articles to be open.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt the reopener proposals.

items.item_details:
This item policy details board policies governing the election of board officers. Consonant with our review process, existing policies are compared with model CCLC policies and include a time frame for input through the participatory governance process:
	 
  
May 28:    The policy was first introduced to the Board of Trustees as a "first read."  And after the summer break and recommended changes, it followed the    required process of review at District Council twice (first as an introductory read and a second time as final review after constituent dissemination).
 
Sept 19:    Introduction/first read by District Council; dissemination of soft copy for constituent review.
 
October 17:  Second District Council meeting with suggested input from constituent groups. 
 
November 1:  Received suggested edits after legal review conducted by attorney Randy Parent of Cassidy, Liebert, Cassidy & Whitmore. 
 
Therefore, based on the above review and consultation, it is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve BP 2210 (Officers).
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Board Policy 2210 (Officers).
items.item_text: BP 2210 Officers
items.item_text_raw: 7. BP 2210 Officers

items.item_details:
Consonant with our 20% annual review process of board policies, Chapter 6 (District Business and Fiscal Affairs) is presented for approval by the Board of Trustees.   With the exception of BP 6331 (Procurement Cards) which is a new district policy added after the first reading of Chapter 6 by the Board, the chapter is complete.  BP 6331 is currently under the review process by District Council constituents and will be presented at a forthcoming Board meeting. The timeline below details the review process of the attached board policies in Chapter 6. 
	 
April 18, 2013:  Presented to District Council on April 18, 2013 as a "first read" and for subsequent dissemination to constituent groups 
	 
September 16, 2013: second read  at District Council meeting (final input and suggestions/changes made)  
	 
October 8, 2013:  First read to the Board of Trustees 
	 
Based on the above review and consultation, it is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Chapter 6 Board Policies (Business & Fiscal Affairs).
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Chapter 6 (Business and Fiscal Affairs).
items.item_text: Chapter 6 Board Policies (Business & Fiscal Affairs)
items.item_text_raw: 8. Chapter 6 Board Policies (Business & Fiscal Affairs)

items.item_details:
California Code of Regulations Section 58305(d) requires districts to prepare an Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311) to the State Chancellor's Office.  The report is the vehicle for summarizing and communicating the results of budgetary decisions and transactions of all governmental, proprietary, and fiduciary funds for the fiscal year.  The information is then compiled system-wide by the State Chancellor's Office.
	 
The attached Fiscal Year 2012-2013 Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311) is presented to the Board of Trustees as an information item.
items.item_text: FY2012-2013 Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311)
items.item_text_raw: 1. FY2012-2013 Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311)

items.item_details:
Information will include a review of the First Quarter Budget Report for the period ending September 30, 2013.  The State budget, current District financial position, and estimates for FY 2013/2014, FY 2014/2015, FY 2015/2016, and FY 2016/2017 are presented.
	 
The FY 2013/2014 First Quarter Budget Report was provided to the Board of Trustees under separate cover.  An electronic copy is attached to this Board item.

items.item_details:
Administrative Procedure 6380 stipulates that the “District’s goal is to remove any and all barriers to a
full and equal opportunity for minority-owned [, small] and [women]-owned businesses to provide
products and services to the District… No vendor shall be excluded from consideration for, or award of,
District purchases on the basis of ethnic group identification, race, color, language, accent, immigration
status, ancestry, national origin, age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, transgender, marital status,
veteran status, physical or mental disability, or on the basis of these characteristics or association with a
person or group with one or more of these characteristics.”
	 
Attached is a presentation to provide information on the outreach program and the continuing efforts by
District staff and Gilbane to encourage participation by minority-owned, women-owned, and small
businesses. Also, for reference is analysis which compares three years of information (FY 2010-2011, FY
2011-2012 and FY 2012-2013) on the diversity of the District’s vendors who chose to self–identify on
the District’s Business Enterprise Certification form. The attached analysis represents:
	 
1. Other Funds (Non Measure G-2010)
Amount Paid – Amount paid to vendors that self-identify into each category.
Distribution – Current Fiscal Year distribution in each category.
Prior FY Growth – Prior Fiscal Year growth in each category.
	 
2. Measure G-2010
Amount Paid – Amount paid to vendors that self-identify into each category.
Distribution – Current Fiscal Year distribution in each category.
Prior FY Growth – Prior Fiscal Year growth in each category.
items.item_text: Minority-Owned and Women-Owned Business Report

items.item_details:
In development of the 2025 Facilities Master Plan (FMP) for Evergreen Valley College (EVC), data related to the Evergreen Fault adjacent to campus was updated and depicted on the FMP site plan.  That data and plan identified portions of the EVC campus to be within a State-designated Alquist-Priolo Special Study Zone.  California Geologic Survey Publication 42, âFault Rupture Hazard Zones in Californiaâ requires designation of an area within 50 feet of an active fault as a no-build zone.  This requirement places the Roble and Acacia buildings at EVC within this no-build zone.
	 
This presentation is to inform the Board and identify current and future activities related to the Evergreen Fault and Evergreen Valley College.
